mixtral-8x7b_direct_sole-planning_result:
Here's a suggested 7-day travel plan for two persons starting from Chattanooga and covering three different cities in Georgia while staying within your budget of $6,900:

Day 1 - March 9, 2022 (Chattanooga)
- Arrive in Chattanooga and spend the day exploring local attractions. Suggested activities include visiting the Tennessee Aquarium, Walnut Street Bridge, and Lookout Mountain Incline Railway. Stay overnight at a private room accommodation with no children under 10 or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $1069)

Day 2 - March 10, 2022 (Chattanooga to Augusta)
- Depart Chattanooga in the morning and embark on a self-driving journey to Augusta, which takes approximately 3 hours and 57 minutes. Enjoy the scenic route and stop for breaks along the way if needed. Upon arrival, check into a private room accommodation with no pets or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $1034)

Day 3 - March 11, 2022 (Augusta)
- Explore Augusta's local attractions such as the Augusta Museum of History, Riverwalk Augusta, and Morris Museum of Art. Stay overnight at a private room accommodation with no parties or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $587)

Day 4 - March 12, 2022 (Augusta to Decatur)
- Check out from your accommodation in Augusta and embark on a self-driving journey to Decatur, which takes approximately 3 hours and 36 minutes. Upon arrival, check into a private room accommodation with no pets or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $1069)

Day 5 - March 13, 2022 (Decatur)
- Explore Decatur's local attractions such as the Fernbank Museum of Natural History, Decatur Square, and the DeKalb History Center. Stay overnight at a private room accommodation with no pets or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $1130)

Day 6 - March 14, 2022 (Decatur to Atlanta)
- Check out from your accommodation in Decatur and embark on a self-driving journey to Atlanta, which takes approximately 19 minutes. Upon arrival, check into a private room accommodation with no pets or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $1300)

Day 7 - March 15, 2022 (Atlanta to Chattanooga)
- Depart Atlanta in the morning and embark on a self-driving journey back to Chattanooga, which takes approximately 1 hour and 47 minutes. Upon arrival, check into a private room accommodation with no pets or visitor restrictions. (Estimated cost: $900)

Total estimated cost for accommodations is $6,000, leaving you with an additional budget of $900 for transportation, food, and activities during your trip. To avoid air travel, we recommend self-driving between the cities, which will add minimal costs to your overall budget while allowing you to enjoy scenic routes and flexibility in scheduling.
